if you are having problems with the game closing to the desktop, make sure you have the fixed crack:
http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/6331819/Portal_2_Crack_Fix-SKIDROW  (this one you're at now)

and that you have copied it's contents to the right folder. The most common error is copying "client.dll" and "server.dll" to "GAME FOLDER/bin" when te correct is "GAME FOLDER/portal2/bin". 
The other stuff goes directly in to the default GAME FOLDER.

That's what i was doing wrong. Hope it helps.

Ok everyone listen up. For anyone whos having the common problem that the game starts but it exits right at the starting loading screen this is the solution. In C:\Program Files\Valve\Portal 2 theres a folder called Portal 2 . The crack you need to copy is in there. Do not copy the crack in bin folder.Just take the whole things in the crack folder and copy them in C:\Program Files\Valve\Portal 2 . Do not enter C:\Program Files\Valve\Portal 2\bin ! Hope that helps!

CHAPTER 9 !!!

ok for all who have trouble getting this to work:
1.copy the map says portal2 in the skidrow file and then go to the map in c:/program files/valve/portal2 and without opening the portal2 map paste the portal2 map and replace if asked.
2.copy the portal.exe{and you can also take the launcher and the skidrow configuration text file in one time,worked for me}and copy this in the same map{c:/progamfiles/valve/portal2 and paste them also in this file without opening it.
3.and now you copy the Steamclient.dll 1.0.01 and go to c:/progamfiles/valve/portal2 and now!! you open!!! the portal2 map and find the map called bin and paste the steamclient.dll file in there{again whithout opening the map bin,just rightclick on the bin map and paste the steamclient.dll file}.
4.and now{and this is the only different file compared to the original crack map thats with the complete torrent}you copy the sr-port2cf.sfv svf file and go to the c:/progamfiles/valve/portal2 map and rightclick on the portal2 map and paste it{i dont now what it does but the first time i tryed it without this file the game wouldent start up all the way,i did reinstalled the game after the first time diddint worked}and that worked for me.

i cant explain it any more clear then this.

good luck and lots of fun with the game because it is lol

*****For those with Win7 x64 and are having problems with "no steam/quit", change your compatibility mode to windows xp (sp3). 

I also checked "run as an administrator" but don't know if that matters.

To play coop over lan or Hamachi:

1) Enter the game one both computers and Enable Developer Console in the options.

2) Hit " ` " to open the console. Then type in... sv_lan 1.

3) The client should connect first as it disconnects if the host is in the empty game for a few seconds, but the client can wait forever.
Client: Type into the console... connect  replacing the  with an ip.
For example... connect 192.168.1.3

4) Host then selects the map by entering into their own console... map mp_coop_ replacing the  with the name of the map of choice listed below.
For example... map mp_coop_start

5) The host will connect and the client will see the blue bar fill, finally entering the game.

Map List (In Order)
"mp_coop_start"
"mp_coop_lobby_2"
"mp_coop_doors"
"mp_coop_race_2"
"mp_coop_laser_2"
"mp_coop_rat_maze"
"mp_coop_laser_crusher"

petjax - followed your instructions, there is an error in what you have said. The steam.dll DOES NOT go into the bin folder - it goes into the main portal2 folder. Tried it after deleting steam file from bin folder, then pasting into first portal 2 folder - and guess what - it fucking works!!
Anyone can play offline? I mean like with no internet at all (disabled).

::::::EVERYONE::::::

HERE IS HOW TO FIX PORTAL 2 ON WIN 7
((  LISTEN CAREFULLY  ))

First, drag the file named "LAUNCHER.exe" into the directory of  Valve\Portal 2\bin

NEXT: Drag the file "PORTAL2.exe" into the directory of  Valve\Portal 2

THEN: Drag the file named " STEAMCLIENT.DLL" into the same directory of   Valve\Portal 2

THEN: OPEN the folder named Portal 2 from the crack, then open the folder named "bin" (STILL INSIDE THE CRACK FILE). Once you see "client.dll" and "server.dll", Then drag those to the directory of   Valve\Portal 2\bin

NEXT: THIS IS THE STEP YOU ALL FORGOT BECAUSE YOU THOUGHT IT WAS JUST A READ-ME. *******READ*******
 You need to drag the file named "Skidrow.ini" into the directory of   Valve\Portal 2

((((  THIS IS A MUST  )))) **This is what you all didn't do which caused the game to be rendered useless.**

~~  You can now forget about the left over .NFO file. That has nothing to do with the game being able to run  ~~

Once this is all done, you should now be very able to run the game. Please don't forget the most important step: GET THE CAKE!!!! ;)

And to "extremezone" and "skidrow", Thanks for the files guys. Love this game! :)

For those of you with the "App ID is not configured" and the only buttons you see are "No steam" and "Quit" If you have windows 7 x64, you need to right click portal 2 and run as administrator. If that doesn't work, then right click again go to proprieties > compatibility and run it in compatibility mode for windows xp (Service pack 3)

Right click on the Portal2.exe and choose for Run as Administrator for Win 7/Vista users. That's the solution for the APPID problem!

Sorry, but I just can't help LoL -ing @ the line "Dear Valve Software, we are crackers, not your problem solvers!"

in the torrent description.  I know what you MEANT by it, and you're totally RIGHT about it (if indeed the legit owners ALSO experience the crash you fixed)...  but my twisted mind just took that quote in a completely different (and quite humorous) way..

---

---

LoL -- crackers!

---

Anyway -- good work, and THANKS for it, seriously.

---

..Please keep up the good work, you crackers..  LoL.

(disclaimer: i wasn't intending to seriously offend anyone..  sorry if i did..  i'm just a guy on the internet, having fun, enjoying humor when i see it.  whether or not a quote was INTENDED in the way it becomes INTERPRETED, is an independent factor, and in my opinion, FAIR GAME. That's a part of the artistic beauty of the world we live in :)

---

This is a great game, by the way.  I loved part one, especially the ending..  The song at the end was hilarious, and made it feel like it was WORTH having conquered all the levels..  I can't wait to beat part 2, but I'm only beginning, and with my hectic work schedule, I probably won't beat the game until a few weeks from now..  

Once the levels get harder, later in the game, I'll probably only ATTEMPT to conquer one or two levels per night, then quit..  then SKIP a few nights here or there, if I'm busy -- just like I did with part one...  the brilliance of that strategy, is that when I get to a new level, I'll at least PREVIEW it, and run around in it, just a little bit, to see what I'm UP against..  So even when I'm AWAY from the game, I'll be THINKING about it, while doing other things.. and then a PLAN will pop into my mind, and I'll be anxious to TRY it the next time I DO get home and play the game.

I purposely left the above description (of how I play part one AND two) rather VAGUE, because I didn't want to spoil anything for anyone new..  But BELIEVE me - you'll have a BLAST..  Cheers!

Portal 2

To play coop over lan or Hamachi:

1) Enter the game one both computers and Enable Developer Console in the options.

2) Hit " ` " to open the console. Then type in... sv_lan 1.

3) The client should connect first as it disconnects if the host is in the empty game for a few seconds, but the client can wait forever.
Client: Type into the console... connect replacing the with an ip.
For example... connect 192.168.1.3

4) Host then selects the map by entering into their own console... map mp_coop_ replacing the with the name of the map of choice listed below.
For example... map mp_coop_start

5) The host will connect and the client will see the blue bar fill, finally entering the game.


Part 1

mp_coop_start
mp_coop_lobby_2
mp_coop_doors
mp_coop_race_2
mp_coop_laser_2

How to correctly apply the Crack Fix to play Portal 2:

1: Download the crack folder

2: Extract the Rar file to an empty folder or the current open folder.

3: Open the Portal 2 Directory:
(Windows users) C: > Program Files(x86)/ may be different for non 64 bit users) Valve > Portal 2

4: Select the following from the crack folder:
-portal2
-Launcher
-portal2(application)
-steam
-Steamclient.dll
-Skidrow(Look at *NOTE* below)
(Do not open the portal2 folder from the crack folder, just select the whole folder along with the others)

5: Right click > Copy

6: Paste to Portal 2 folder(directory) and agree to any popups asking to replace or merge(it does it all for you)

7: Run Launcher as administrator.

*NOTE* May be optional but if you encounter problems when the game runs such as no steam or something else go back to the crack folder and open Skidrow. Then change PlayerName =(your choice, make it small) also, once this or any other file is in the Portal 2 directory folder it CANNOT be changed, if you try to save it there it will try and save it as a text.

Cont...
Problem:
Skidrow wasn't copied and the entire thing was put in the Portal 2 folder now cant change it.
Fix:
Copy the one from the portal 2 folder and paste on the desktop or open folder. Open it and change PlayerName since it's not in the portal 2 folder it can now be saved as the same thing not to a text then simply place the altered file back into the portal 2 folder and replace it.

Aftermath, Should be able to now play Portal 2. You can delete the crack folder if you wish. It's no longer needed.

~By Scrotty

At first portal 2 kept shutting down or going mad (black screen, looping audio fragments) when I loaded my previous save. The way to solve this is to right click 'portal2.exe', click on properties and go to the 'compatibility' tab. Select run as administrator and switch the compatibility mode to 'Windows XP SP3'. Then close the properties and double click 'portal2.exe' to run it. It should work fine right now.
Next time you start up portal 2, it will probably crash again so the thing to do is: turn off the compatibility mode of 'portal2.exe' again. The next time turn it on again, then turn it of again, etc. You should all get the point, just keep switching the compatibility mode on and off.
